top_comments.comment: Video idea: full face of makeup that’s older than YouTube.
I feel like Covergirl eyeshadow looks beautiful going on, but has zero staying power. It’s gone by lunch no matter what eyeshadow primer I use!

"a wiggle and a pull"...in my mind i heard "a bushel and a peck", and now the song, which my dad used to sing to me all the time, is gloriously stuck in my head. Thank you for that, it's my favorite part of the video. I know that's probably weird to everyone else, but...🖤
I love that light color for pale skin in the blush palette! Gives a bit of life to the skin in a not pink way which generally light colors are pink.

I LOVE Cover Girl clean makeup foundation! My shade is buff beige. I've tried so many and go back to that one. Those eye shadows are gorgeous too! You are the "Blush Goddess", you know how to put on just the right amount! Lovely!!

comments_since_last_sample.body: We took a sip of coffee at the same time haha this is a relaxing morning watching your video while doing my makeup
I think that lip color looks good on you

Hey Em, loved this try it out video and omg the Charlotte Tilbury video was so good too! I'm low key wanting to buy all the things you mentioned. But I also had this thought, have you thought about doing a "this is how to apply makeup" series? Like going through and explaining: where to put highlighter/bronzer, what some products do, how to do your brows, eye looks, etc. I ask because as a woman that didn't learn makeup from a female figure in her life, I've had to pick up things from YouTube and I still get some stuff wrong (hello contour). And I wonder if there are other men and women out there like me who would love to learn the basics or even some more advanced techniques. I think the way you talk to the audience and the explanations you do in videos are great and I love to hear you talk about how products work. I'd love to learn so much more from you.  <3
Happy Saturday, Emily & other beauties! I'm in my late 50s and I remember when we used Noxema for our night cream. I'll never forget that smell. lol Intrigued by the Milani cream blushes!
taking the warm palette... what a shocking move... ohh wait... again?

I went out and bought the Cover Girl Clean make-up Foundation today! I forgot all about it!  I loved it so much! 
Thanks for the walk down memory lane lol
Happy Saturday Em!! Those blush palettes are so nice!! Covergirl shadows have never been a fav of mine, but these really impressed me as well as the Colourpop mascara! Beautiful look as always🥰😍
OMG that Cover Girl ad with Niki Taylor 😭 my youth! Take me back to reading YM Magazine and wishing I were Tiffani Amber Thiessen

I LOVE Cover Girl clean makeup foundation! My shade is buff beige. I've tried so many and go back to that one. Those eye shadows are gorgeous too! You are the "Blush Goddess", you know how to put on just the right amount! Lovely!!

Beautiful look Emily~Ive been living for
All these stunning Fall colors 🍁⭐🍎🎈❤️

Your skin looks so radiant and healthy! Loved the look, I have never had much luck with cover girl foundations but that clean skin looks so fresh I might have to check it out for those quick light coverage days.
Oh man I love this warm palette and as alway the warm ones look super sexy on u!!!!
I love that light color for pale skin in the blush palette! Gives a bit of life to the skin in a not pink way which generally light colors are pink.
Omg I love the lipstick girl
Emily, do you or anyone reading know a dupe for shimmering sands? Bc I don’t want to pay $20 or whatever on Amazon .. lol. Especially when it was $2.50 lol. I love that desert heat pallet.
Video idea: full face of makeup that’s older than YouTube.
I feel like Covergirl eyeshadow looks beautiful going on, but has zero staying power. It’s gone by lunch no matter what eyeshadow primer I use!
Why is it always Thrive for your lower lashes?
Emily, you’ve stopped using your Elf concealer brush 😔You recommended it and I’ve bought 2 since then, lol! Love Saturday mornings with you ☺️

"a wiggle and a pull"...in my mind i heard "a bushel and a peck", and now the song, which my dad used to sing to me all the time, is gloriously stuck in my head. Thank you for that, it's my favorite part of the video. I know that's probably weird to everyone else, but...🖤
